fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL function 'withinCalendarHours' in automation rule does not work when trigger is set as 'issue created' even though the SLA is actualy within Calendar hours.
 When trigger is set as 'Comment added' it works fine.

Document of 'withinCalendarHours' is here :
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/advanced-searching-functions-reference-939937025.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-withincalendarhourswithinCalendarHours(])
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule like below image.
!スクリーンショット 2020-02-18 9.58.09.png|width=770,height=467!
 # Create a issue when SLA is within Calendar hours.

h3. Expected Results

The rule ran without any problems.
h3. Actual Results

The rule did not ran.
!スクリーンショット 2020-02-18 10.00.00.png|width=793,height=481!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL function 'withinCalendarHours' in automation rule does not work when trigger is set as 'issue created'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The public api ( {{rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueID}/approval/\{approvalID}}} ) fails when using it to approve or decline a request that has no request type. This is different to the behaviour of the web interface agents view where a user is able to approve/decline a request successfully even if it has no request type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a service desk project with approvals using the global create and leave the request type blank
 # Use the public api to approve the request

h3. Expected Results

The request is successfully approved, the same result as if I were to approve the request using the agent view web interface.
h3. Actual Results

The request fails with a 400 error code
h3. Workaround
 *  Set a valid request type for the ticket.
fields.summary: Attempting to approve or decline a request using the public api fails when request type is not set

fields.description:
h3. Problem description:

When there isn't a value because there weren't any tickets submitted that meet the filter, the entry is displaying the value zero, which isn't the true average.

This makes so that the customer may need to exclude the zero entries from the .csv value to have the true average.

h3. Suggestion:

Add an option to leave the values as blank instead of zero when the criteria isn't met.
fields.summary: SLA Average Series should display a blank value when the filter isn't met

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently in the Service Desk portal is based on a set of rules. If there are more than 5 comments, it will activate the collapsing comment feature. If there are a total of 6 comments, it will bundle the 3 comments under "Show 3 more" and show the latest 3 comments.

*Suggested Solution*

It would be helpful for the Service Desk administrators to be able to control the limit of how many comments are required to activate the collapsed functionality or have a toggle that allows them to turn the collapsed comment feature on and off. 

This way the Service Desk administrator can adjust it based on the convenience of the Service Desk customer and their portal experience with the service given.
fields.summary: Ability to Control Collapsed Comment Limit in Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When replying to a customer with a video attached, the link to the video fails to render

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any service desk ticket attach a video
# Reply to customer
# Check the email notification received on customer end.

h3. Expected Results
A link to the video is rendered in the email notification
h3. Actual Results
An error is retunered 
{code}Unable to embed resource: bandicam 2020-02-12 10-49-58-286 (0fad8c36-279f-43f0-8499-c805bdf72338).mp4 of type video/mp4{code}

h3. Workaround
Use the old issue view when attaching images.
fields.summary: Video in customer email notification fail to renders [New issue view]

fields.description:
I would to request the ability to incorporate custom fields and order to the export functionality for Service Desk:

!image-2020-02-14-13-27-20-839.png|width=156,height=238!

 

It would be very helpful to able to see certain fields in the export that do not show up via the standard export functionality.
fields.summary: Add Custom Fields to Service Desk Export via CSV

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you're editing the queue filters and select a date picker field, the calendar icon is not opening the calendar with the dates. You can check it in the following video.

* https://cl.ly/6715b51e5f53

We got the same result on Google Chrome, Firefox, and Safari.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit a queue.
# Include a date picket field on the basic search.
# Try to open the calendar to select the date.

h3. Expected Results

The calendar should be displayed as it's in the *Jira Search*.

 !Jira_Search.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The icon is not working and we couldn't find any error in the console.

h3. Workaround

Include the date manually.
fields.summary: The calendar icon of date picker fields is not working inside the queue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the user only able to search the Assets value from the JQL using "appKey/originId" format. It will be easier to search using "Label" value because that's what displaying in the issue

h3. Suggested Solution
Able to search using assets "Label" value.

h3. Why this is important
Easier for users to search in the JQL

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow to search Assets using its "Label" value in the JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JSD/Confluence permissions should only allow access to Confluence space associated with the project

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Currently, the user who signs up to Jira service desk and who has access to a particular project have access for all the KB articles irrespective of the space in Confluence


h3. Expected Results
User who has access to a JSD project should have access to only the KB article linked with the project


h3. Actual Results

Once granted access, the user will be able to access all the KB article in confluence irrespective of the space connected to the project

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSD/Confluence permissions should only allow access to Confluence space associated to the project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a checkbox field to a queues' column breaks the layout

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Within a Jira Service Desk Next-Gen project create a request type
# On that request type configure a checkbox field
# Create at least 14 options for that field
# Now configure your queue columns to display the checkbox field
# Create a few issues selection all the values for the above checkbox

h3. Expected Results
While accessing the queue the values should be displayed just fine.

h3. Actual Results
An empty space is created between your tickets.
 !queue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Remove the checkbox column from the queue
fields.summary: Adding a checkbox field to a queues' column breaks the layout

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a customer have JIRA access and add a comment from JIRA , it will automatically set to "Internal Comment".

h3. Suggested Solution
Give option for the user to add internal comment or external comment

h3. Why this is important
Give flexibility for JIRA user to add comment from JIRA or Customer Portal

h3. Workaround 
No workaround. The user have to add comment from Customer Portal to make external comment.
fields.summary: Allow customers with JIRA access to add external comment from JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Selecting *Set to current time by default* for next-gen *Time tracking* field does not respect time zone preference. Instead, it shows UTC/GMT time.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a nextgen Jira Service Desk project
 # Add a *Time tracking* field
 # Check *Set to current time by default*
 # Visit that request type in the portal
 # Observe that the time is showing incorrectly (e.g., showing 10:30PM instead of 04:30PM with their timezone set to CST (UTC-6)

h3. Expected Results
The user's timezone is used to show the time.

h3. Actual Results
The UTC/GMT time zone is used to show the time.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Selecting "Set to current time by default" for next-gen "Time tracking" field does not respect time zone preference

fields.description:
Currently, the main _Requests_ button constantly shows the number of requests in a user's profile. Typically, this type of badge shows only the amount of unread/updates, not a total.

My recommendation and suggestion is to change the behavior of this badge counter, to only show the number of unread changes or updates to the user's requests. _Not_ the total count.
fields.summary: Clear badge counter in "Requests" button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The user would like to embed a third-party widget into Jira Service Desk Portal. This will allow users to integrate custom chatbots and other widgets to be integrated into their portal.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a functionality of adding third-party widgets using their API or similar scripts.
h3. Workaround

Users can look into creating an Atlassian Connect app for embedding the widget.
fields.summary: Allow embedding of third-party widgets into Jira Service Desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Projects can't have more than 50 queues. Customer may need to create queues based on components, products...
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users creating and viewing more than 50 queues
h3. Workaround

 [Creating filters|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/save-your-search-as-a-filter/] as an alternative for queues
fields.summary: Allow more than 50 queues on Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
SLA events that trigger notifications or other events in Jira Service Desk automation may start looping. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
_This is an intermittent issue and not reliably reproducible _
 # Create Jira Service Desk project
 # Create an SLA rule and goal in the JSD project
 # Create an automation rule that triggers on an SLA breaching event.

h3. Expected Results
When the SLA breach the rule is triggered once.

h3. Actual Results
When the SLA is breached multiple breach events are fired by Rolex causing the automation rule to trigger multiple times.

h3. Workaround
Currently, it seems that making a change to the automation rule which is looping, saving this change will stop the looping.
After the change is made and looping has stopped the change can be reverted. 

If this does not work or you are finding consistent issues with this happening please contact Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: SLA breach events causes looping triggers of automation rules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Customer notifications in the French language pack in Jira Service desk cloud adds some special characters into the email templates. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project settings > Language support and add the French language.
 # Check the customer notification templates for the below.
 ## Customer-visible status changed
 ## Approval required
 ## Organization added
 ## Participant added
 ## Request resolved
 ## Public comment edited
 ## Public comment added

h3. Expected Results

The templates provide the required text for the email templates.
h3. Actual Results

Below is an example of the text for the Customer-visible status changed event.
 !Screenshot 2020-02-11 at 6.04.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

The users can modify the email templates as required from the project settings.
fields.summary: Customer notification in French language pack has special characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a service desk customer receives and service desk email notification containing an attachment URL, if they click on the URL to open it without already being logged in, they will have to go through the login during the process and this will result in a page with spinner with no progress due to a malformed attachment URL trying to load. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a service desk customer, open a notification email containing a link to at attachment added to request ticket.
# Click on the attachment URL > page will redirect to the portal login > Complete the login.
# You'll be redirected to a page with a progress spinner and the attachment will not open.

h3. Expected Results

After the login is complete, you should be redirected to the attachment URL and be able to view the attachments.

h3. Actual Results
You'll be redirected to a page with a progress spinner and the attachment will not load. The URL of the attachments is malformed. 

h3. Workaround
1. After clicking on the link to access the attachment and being directed to the login page > Complete the login 
2. Go back to the email inbox and click on the attachment link once again to correctly access it.
fields.summary: Unable to view attachments in the portal when opening an attachment from notification email without being logged in

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in the new issue view, the field in request form configuration will display in the middle of the page when it's created via portal or email. It will also display when the field is empty.

The Field layout configuration only allows hiding the field when it's empty for the issue view configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Why this is important
 Provide option to hide field when it's empty for request form configuration.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: In the New issue view, able to hide field in "Request Form" configuration when it's empty

fields.description:
When updating a ticket (e.g., satisfying the conditions for an SLA) in the new issue view, the page doesn't update for over a minute to show that the issue has met that SLA.

The delay for the old issue view is typically a couple of seconds and when doing so in the new issue view, refreshing the page shows that the SLA has been met already. As such, it seems to just be a polling time setting (to see if anything has updated) for the new issue view.
fields.summary: Decrease update poll time for new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

SLAs that have security-level as Goals aren't displaying at the issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Issue security configuration
 # Create an SLA with the *Entered Status* or *Issue Created* start
 # Set the issue security ( level ) as one of the Goals filters
 # Create a ticket and initiate the start event of the SLA

h3. Expected Results

The SLA begins to count and is displayed at the issue view.
h3. Actual Results

The SLA begins to count, on the backend, however, it isn't displayed at the issue view.

h3. Solution / Workaround

The only workaround to display the SLA information is to remove the *Issue security* from the JQL Goal.
fields.summary: SLAs that have security-level as Goals aren't displaying at the issue view.

fields.description: In Jira Service Desk Server, when I create a custom field I can import values from a CSV list. In Jira Service Desk Cloud, I am not able to massively import a list of items to insert in a custom field. This is a very useful function.
fields.summary: Bulk Import Values in a Custom Field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The static text such as "Share with (organization)" could be more meaningful if it can be edited to "Send to (organization)". This depends on the type of customers being served.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to edit the static text
fields.summary: Ability to edit the static text in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a Google Drive for Confluence macro to a Confluence page will display correctly from within Confluence. However, displaying this Confluence page from within a service desk knowledge base view, the macro is blank.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install [Google Drive for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]
# Add the macro on a Confluence page in a space linked to a service desk project.
# Add a Google drive link to a doc that is publically accessible > Publish page
# Go to the service desk project > Knowledge Base, open the page from there. 

h3. Expected Results
From Confluence the view is  !image-2020-02-07-21-11-09-837.png|thumbnail! 
From the knowledge base, the macro should display the Google doc preview similarly to how it does in the Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results
From the knowledge base view the macro does not load: !image-2020-02-07-21-12-01-451.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Insert Google drive link to the Confluence. However, this will have no preview.
fields.summary: Google Drive for Confluence marco does not work on service desk knowledge base

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently if you apply a transition via api it'll throw `Customer transitions have not yet been implemented in next-gen projects` error.

This feature request will allow transitions as it currently does for classic project
fields.summary: Allow customer transitions in next-gen projects via api

fields.description:
There are a number of unlabeled buttons on many pages, namely the Account icon with the initials/avatar.

For users who reply on screenreader accessibility software (e.g., VoiceOver, JAWS, and NVDA) to read text, the buttons do not have text that can use voice over functionality.
fields.summary: Portal buttons do not seem to have screen reader compatible text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Date/Time picker fields, when filed by Atlassian Accounts on the customer portal will use the instance default timezone instead of the one configured on the Atlassian Account settings

*Environment*

Have an Atlassian Account in a different timezone than the *Default user time zone* configured at <instance-url>/secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Logged as the AA, access a service desk portal
# have a custom date/time picker field on a request type
# choose any date and time on the field
# create the ticket


h3. Expected Results
The ticket will be created with the date/time based on the Atlassian Account's timezone settings

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is created with the date/time based on the instance's *Default user time zone* settings, and the time shown after the ticket is created will erroneously be adjusted with the timezone differences

Example:

# An Atlassian Account with timezone set to Americas/Recife (GMT-3) creating a ticket on a service desk with the default of Americas/Phoenix (GMT-7) inputs 10am on the date/time field.
# After the ticket is created, it should still be displayed as 10am, however, it'll be displayed as 2pm (difference of four hours), because the timezone used to create the ticket was GMT-7, when it should have been GMT-3.


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Date/time discrepancies when raising a request on the portal as an Atlassian Account with different timezone from the instance's default

fields.description:
Currently , there's is a limitation on using JIRA Service Desk feature to other project type . For example :-

* Fields cannot be used in other project types


Suggested Solution
Provide configurable settings to add the feature to any project type
fields.summary: Jira service desk field should be usable in other project type (business or software)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Cannot save "Request participants" from the list of available fields for the new
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project Settings -> Request Type -> New Request Type
 # Select "Request Participants" from the right hand side panel
 # Drag and drop it to the "Context fields" area
 # Click save

h3. Expected Results
 * "Request participants" field is saved 

h3. Actual Results
 * All new fields are saved except for "Request participants"

h3. Workaround
Please contact support for the workaround
fields.summary: Next-gen: "Request Participants" and "Organization" field is not saving

fields.description: Currently, clicking on a link from a *Jira Service Desk* portal's knowledge base opens the article in the same tab. It would be nice if there was an option which could allow the user to select their preference and for the administrator to choose a default for users accessing anonymously.
fields.summary: Provide an option so that knowledge base articles can be opened in the same tab or a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using a voice over utility (e.g., *VoiceOver*, *JAWS*, or *NVDA*) on draggable items (e.g., queues in the *Queues* list of a *Jira Service Desk* project), screen readers are not able to read the text of the individual queues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable a screen reader
 # Visit a page with draggable items (e.g., the *Queues* page)
 # Observe that the text of the queues are not read

h3. Expected Results
The text of the queues should be read so that users using Accessibility applications/utilities can hear the text on the page.

h3. Actual Results
Other text within the source code is read or generic voice over utility information is read.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: When using VoiceOver for draggable elements, the text is not read

fields.description: Currently, my projects are showing in the order in which they were created. I would love to be able to move them around based upon priority. Is this functionality currently available as I cannot find it anywhere?
fields.summary: The Ability to Sort Service Desk Projects in the Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When dragging the *Knowledge base* field from the *Context fields* section to the *Hidden fields* section, the field is shown under both sections and still appears when viewing issues in Jira.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on *Edit fields* next to a request type
# Go to the *Issue view* tab
# Drag the *Knowledge base* field from the *Context fields* section to the *Hidden fields* section
# Click *Save changes*
# Refresh the page (observe the field being in both the *Context fields* section and the *Hidden fields* section)
# Go to an issue for that request type (observe the field is still shown)

h3. Expected Results
The field is shown in the *Hidden fields* section only and the field is not shown in the issue view.

h3. Actual Results
The field is shown in issue view as well as both the *Context fields* section and the *Hidden fields* section and when viewing issues of the request type.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Moving the Knowledge base field from Context fields to Hidden fields on the Issue view tab doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
SLAs that should start on specific events trigger will not show up if a custom event is configured in the project's workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Jira events (site.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ListEventTypes.jspa) and create a custom event using the *Issue Created* template
# Configure an SLA that starts on the "Issue Created" trigger.
# Edit the very first transition of your workflow, and change the "Fire event" post-function, replacing the regular "Issue Created" with the fresh custom event.
# Save and publish your workflow
# Create a new ticket that should have the SLA created before.

h3. Expected Results
The ticket has the SLA

h3. Actual Results
The SLA will not start, however, performing any action on the ticket (assigning, commenting, editing) will trigger the SLA to appear.

*Notes*
* This also affects other generic events templates such as Issue Updated, Issue Comment Edited...

h3. Workaround

Use system events instead.
fields.summary: SLAs do not start if the workflow uses a custom Issue event

fields.description:
We have customers that want all communication to and from Jira Servicedesk to be S/MIME encrypted.

Currently there are limitations in the Jira Cloud that prevent the implementation of S/MIME support.

Information from savignano software solutions (Developer of the addon S/Notify)

‘Hello and thank you very much for your inquiry!

I’m afraid there is no S/Notify for cloud instances of Jira. While we would love to offer cloud support, unfortunately, due to the limitations in Jira Cloud, it is currently impossible to provide this functionality in a cloud app.

We have proposed Atlassian to offer an API for this purpose, but it is unknown if and when they might decide to implement it. Maybe if you or your customer opened an issue about this, this could help.’

I think this is an important issue. Not all customers feel confident exchanging confidential information unencrypted.
fields.summary: Implement API for S/MIME Support

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no variable to add "Created date/time" value in the customer notification.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add "Created date/time" variable in customer notification template configuration.

h3. Why this is important
The administrator would like to inform the customer when the issue created.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Add Issue Created date/time variable in customer notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to view pictures in customer portal when Jira user adds a picture after adding another file type in one line
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue from customer portal 
 # Open this ticket in *Old issue view*
 # Attach any file(not a picture) then attach a second file *.jpg in one line like: 
{code:java}
[^SYD.pdf] !IMG_6298.JPG|thumbnail!
{code}

 # Go to the Customer portal to this ticket. You will see the only PDF file.

h3. Expected Results

All files should be present in the customer portal. Customer should be able to see and download both files from the portal. 
h3. Actual Results

In the customer portal, you can only see the first file and you cannot see jpg file. 
h3. Workaround

Use the double break line when you attach two files like:
{code:java}
[^SYD.pdf]

 

!IMG_6298.JPG|thumbnail!
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to view pictures in customer portal when Jira user adds a picture after adding another file type in one line

fields.description:
It would be great to improve the metrics on articles viewed/searched by customers in service desk. 

To be more precise, the ability to know which JSD customers viewed each article.
fields.summary: Add user who executed the action on Article views from portal report

fields.description:
Currently when initiating a trial of JSD only Next-gen projects are available, by default, so users require to create a Next-gen project, going to *Project settings* > *Advanced* > *Create a Classic project*, if they want to create Classic JSD projects.

This isn't ideal once it's not intuitive for users starting a new site that are trying to create a Classic project.
fields.summary: Enable Classic projects by default when starting a Jira Service Desk trial

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL search returns an error if a next-gen issue type contains a custom field with same name as system field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
on your next-gen service desk project:
# go to Project settings > Request types
# under one of the request type create a field named "Request type"
# save

h3. Expected Results
Jira should indicate and block user from creating a custom field with the same name as a system field (in this case "Request Type"

h3. Actual Results
Jira allows the user to create this custom field
JQL search on "Request Type" throws an error: "The option '<name of request type>' for field 'Request Type' does not exist"

h3. Workaround
*>* removing the "custom field from your next-gen service desk project if you are not using it
*>* Alternatively, you can rename the field:
fields.summary: JQL search returns an error if a next-gen Request type contains a custom field with same name as system field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when a customer signs up for a Jira Service Desk customer account via the portal they receive an email like the one below:
 !Screenshot 2020-02-03 at 17.21.59.png|thumbnail! 
There is currently no way to customize this. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the option to customize this email body to the customer notifications configurations section of the Jira Service Desk project.

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available at this time.
fields.summary: Allow customisation of the notification email received during self signup on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
There's a certain organization not allowing the users to upgrade their Chrome version. However, with the old version , the portal should still work. However, there's a case portal are not loading due to the error below :-
{noformat}
"Access to Script at 'https://jsd-portal-frontend.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets/5.chunk.36174ccafbe8ff05bc46.js' from origin 'https://crefius.atlassian.net' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource. Origin 'https://xxx.atlassian.net' is therefore not allowed access." errors.
{noformat}

By right, To fix it , clearing the cache by :-
1. Push F12 or Ctrl+Shift+J to "Open Developer Tools" on Windows (On Mac: Cmd+Opt+I)
2. Then you can right click on the refresh icon and select 'Empty Cache and Hard Reload'

But there's case , the problem still persists after clearing the cache.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a new tab, paste in the resource url, `https://jsd-portal-frontend.us-east-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets/5.chunk.36174ccafbe8ff05bc46.js` in this case. Then Enter.
# Go back to the customer portal, refresh the page. Then you will see the error.
# Then , clear the browser cache.

h3. Expected Results
Customer Portal should be loaded.
h3. Actual Results
Customer Portal not loaded.

h3. Workaround
Upgrade the Chrome version.
fields.summary: Open Customer Portal using Chrome version 65.0.3325.181 are not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Setting the language for a Jira Service Desk project to Spanish results in malformed translations.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a project's language to Spanish
 # Check *Customer notifications*

h3. Expected Results
The translations should have the correct characters.
h3. Actual Results
The translations do not have the correct characters.
For example:
{noformat}
${event.user.name} te ha aï¿½adido como participante.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually update the notifications in the *Customer notifications* section of the project by clicking on *Edit* and then clicking *Save* after updating the notification.
fields.summary: Setting the language for a JSD project to Spanish results in malformed translations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issues that are cloned receive the SLA with finished cycle even though they don't match the *Start* conditions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Test SLA
# Add *Entered Status: Status 1* ( ensure that this status isn't the first one from your workflow ) condition to trigger the *Start* event
# Add *Entered Status: Status 2* ( or *Resolution: Set* ) condition to trigger the *Stop* event
# Create an issue which will trigger the Test SLA and finish the cycle
# Clone the issue

h3. Expected Results

The Cloned issue doesn't receive the Test SLA once it didn't enter the *Status 1* yet.

h3. Actual Results

The Cloned issue receives the Test SLA with the finished cycle information from the parent issue.

See video: https://cl.ly/cffb6784b03a


h3.Solution / Workaround

No workarounds available at the moment.
fields.summary: Clone Issue clone SLA with finished cycle

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Agents creating tickets on behalf of other Atlassian Accounts on the Portal can't share the ticket with an Organization that the Aa is a member of.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a user who is not a portal user (e.g. an Agent, linked to an Atlassian account) to an Organization
 # Go to the portal
 # Create a ticket on behalf of that Aa

h3. Expected Results

The "Share with" field should appear, defaulting to the Organization that the Aa was added to.
h3. Actual Results
 * The "Share with" fields does not appear

*Notes*
 If the Aa user is logged in at the portal (instead of an agent creating the ticket on behalf of the user), the Share With field will appear properly
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Agents creating tickets on behalf of other Atlassian Accounts on the Portal can't share the ticket with an Organization that the AA is a member of.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when the project customer permission set to "Anyone with an account on ..." , automatically all users have access to the portal. Sometimes there's few users with a different domain ( for example external contractors) , shouldn't have access to it. It's troublesome to restrict the project and manually add the user as a customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the option to restrict customers by domain when the project customer permission set to "Anyone with an account on .." 

h3. Why this is important
It's easier for the user to restrict the project by domain.

h3. Workaround 
* Set the project customer permission to "Customers my team adds to the project"
* Add all user with the same domain to one group.
* Add the group to project "Service Desk Customer" role.
fields.summary: Allow restrict customer by domain when the project customer permission set to "Anyone with an account on .."

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
When an article has editing restrictions in Confluence, the articles cannot be categorized in Jira Service Desk Knowledge base. The articles shows that it has been categorized but when accessing the category, the article is not displayed.

h3. Suggested solution
Warn users about the article having editing restrictions so the users could request for the permission to edit it.
fields.summary: Warn users if a page is restricted when editing the category

fields.description: It would be nice if agents could search based on email address (if not also see them) when trying to add a *Request participant* as users with identical names could get mixed up and this could cause a security issue if the wrong user is selected.
fields.summary: The ability to see and/or search for email address in Request participants fields in new issue view

fields.description:
While using Jira Service Desk, there doesn't appear to be a way to create a ticket / give feedback.

I had to go out through the sales frontend and then follow a path for existing customers to find a way to create a ticket in this ticket tracking application.

Additionally, it's really not clear what component to use for this sort of feedback.
fields.summary: It is ironically difficult to find out how to give feedback from within Jira Service desk.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , sometimes the admin accidentally set the email to *Unread* in their mailbox. Hence , JSD reprocess the email and create a new issue. End up there's a duplicate issue with the same email content.

h3. Suggested Solution
It's best if JSD email processor able to detect the "MessageID" if it already process before successfully. If yes , it will ignore it and will not create a new ticket.

h3. Why this is important
 This is to prevent duplicate issue.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: JSD email processor able to detect the email already being processed before eventhough the email in "Unread" mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Impact field is added by default to Next-Gen Service Desk projects. The field options can be customized per project. However, when setting the SLA goals for one project, the JQL also checks the value for other Next-Gen projects too causing the field to be invalid
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Next-Gen Service Desk project, edit the Impact field options to Large, Moderate and Minor
 # Create a new Next-Gen Service Desk project
# Update any SLA goal in the first project to
{code}Impact = Large{code}

h3. Expected Results
The goal of the SLA is updated to Impact = Large
h3. Actual Results
Error shows
bq. The option 'Large' for field 'Impact' does not exist.

h3. Workaround
Update all Impact fields in all projects to be the same.
fields.summary: Creating goals based on Impact in SLA configuration causes the JQL to be invalid

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an image is attached to the description in the New Issue View, it marks up the image as
{code}
!image|width=697,height=461!
{code}

This causes the image to not display without resizing the window if the description contains a long text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an image and a 40 words text in the Description field
 # View the request in Portal

h3. Expected Results
The image is loaded in the description
h3. Actual Results
The image does not load. It requires the viewer to resize the window to make the image load.

h3. Note
# The description field requires a long text with a large image to trigger the bug
# A long comment or image in comment is required to collapse the description field

h3. Workaround
# Resize the window when viewing the image in description
# In the old issue view, change the markup to thumbnail
fields.summary: Attachment in description in Customer Portal does not load

fields.description:
*Summary*

When editing and setting the Czech language for Langauge Support in the Service Desk Project, there are encoding issues with the default text given. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Go to Project Settings > Language Support > Add "Czech" Language as one of the supported Language
 # Go to "Customer Notification" template, open "Organization Added" you will see the following:

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

*Additional Information*

This encoding issue does not occur in all "Customer Notification" options, as of now the following options have encoding issue by default:

- Public comment added
 - Public comment edited
 - Request reopened
 - Participant added
 - Organization Added
 - Approval required

*Expected Results*

The default translation should come out correctly. 

*Actual Results*

It populates numbers and other encodings that are not relevant to language translation.

*Workaround*
 The user will have to manually edit the section based on the understanding of the language. and save the changes to ensure the encoding issue doesn't occur when notification is triggered.
fields.summary: Czech Language Support Has Encoding Issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever there is a security level criteria in SLA goals, the SLA clock is not getting displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1- Create a Security issue scheme and security level
Step 2- Associate the Security issue scheme and security level with a specific project.
Step 3- Create an SLA goal that consists of a security level.

For example priority = Highest AND level = "configured security level"
h3. Expected Results

The SLA clock should be displayed with the SLA goals configured.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
No information is available in logs.{noformat}
h3. Workaround
Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Whenever there is a security level criteria in SLA goals, the SLA clock is not getting displayed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating an issue in the customer portal, users can only select an *Organization* they are a part of under the *Share with* dropdown even when *Any customer or organization, by searching this project. This option allows them to search all customers in the current project.* in *Customer permissions*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to *Customer permissions*
 # Select *Any customer or organization, by searching this project. This option allows them to search all customers in the current project.*
 # Go to customer portal and review options under the *Share with* dropdown
 #* See that the only options are organizations that user is apart of and typing in the *Organization* name/other user

h3. Expected Results
To work like the *Share* button in the portal after a ticket is created.

h3. Actual Results
Only shows *Organization(s)* user is currently a member of.

h3. Workaround
Submit the ticket and then use the *Share* option.
fields.summary: "Any customer or organization...." only works after ticket creation, but not during

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when an existing customer creates issue from portal without login , in the JSD ticket will display it was created from "Anonymous Portal". This confuses the administrator as they thought the issue created by an anonymous users.

h3. Suggested Solution
JSD have ability to detect the issue created by existing customer and will set the issue created from "Portal" instead.

h3. Why this is important
This is to assure the administrator are not confuse with the anonymous user.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround. The only way is to advice existing customer to login to portal before creating the issue.
fields.summary: When existing customer create issue via portal without login , it will not display created from "Anonymous Portal"

fields.description: As a JSD admin or agent, I would like to give the Organization a tag or add a custom field to the Organization so I can link it to other data
fields.summary: Add a label or custom data field to an Organization

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, it is only possible to have a single "Multi-line"/"Paragraph field in the "Customer request form" section in Request types configuration on Next-gen projects. Because the "Description" field already exists, it isn't possible to add any other "Paragraph" field. 

h3. Environment
Next gen service desk projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a next gen service desk project > Project settings
# Select "Request types"
# Click on one of the request types.
# Drag the "Paragraph" field type from the "Create a field" option to the Customer request form" section.

h3. Expected Results

Should be able to create/add other Paragraph fields in the request type form other than the "Description" field. 

h3. Actual Results

Not possible to add "Paragraph" field to Customer request form" section. The only option highlighted it the "Description fields" that is only available internally:  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Cannot add more than one "Paragraph" field on a request type in Next-gen project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the database, the SEARCH_INDEX column of the table AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE store the request type in the format <project-key>/<request-type-key>. Updating the project key does not update the project key value.
 Creating new request types in a project where the project key has been changed will still save the request type with the old project key in the database.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the project key.
 # Create a new request type.
 # Create a new issue with the newly created request type.

h3. Expected Results

When looking up the value of the SEARCH_INDEX for the new issue, it should contain the new project key.
{code:java}
select "SEARCH_INDEX" from "AO_54307E_REQUESTTYPE_TO_ISSUE" where "ISSUE_ID" = <issue id>;
{code}
h3. Actual Results

The value still contains the old project key.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing project key will not update the portal key in the database

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating the Request Type custom field using a post function by inputting the request type name or request type ID will cause the request type to display "No match".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an "Update Issue Custom Field" post function to the workflow.
 # Select the custom field "Request Type".
 # Enter either the request type name or ID as the Custom Field Value.
 # Publish the workflow.
 # Move the issue through the transition containing the post function.

h3. Expected Results

The Request Type custom field should update to the Request Type that matches the name or ID entered in the post function.
h3. Actual Results

The Request Type shows "No match" in the old issue view or empty in the new issue view.
h3. Workaround

Update the request type using automation rules.
fields.summary: Unable to update the request type using post function

fields.description:
We use validator during a transition ("_+*Field Required*+_" | "_Validator Field must not be empty during the transition._") and in the transition screen it doesn't show which fields are mandatory with the red star as it does for field resolution.

Example : 
 # In a workflow add a validator "Field required" and select one or more fields.
 # Add a screen during this transition with these fields
 # Publish your workflow
 # Try the transition

Result : No red stars
fields.summary: Show red start in transition screen when field is mandatory

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a Service Desk request is approved, the following section is added to the request on the portal view:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
The status on the Approval section within the portal view of an issues does not get correctly translated based on the status translation set for any of the sections. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the "Statuses" configuration in Jira > Add a translation for the workflow statuses for a language of choice (mainly the status of the approval stage). 
# Create a Service Desk request that has an approval step
# Approve the Service Desk request
# Open this request from the customer portal
# Change the language of the customer who is viewing the request from the portal to a language with the translated status.

h3. Expected Results

The status found on the approval section should reflect the correct translation set.

h3. Actual Results

The status is not translated in the Approval section on the ticket. While the status is translated correctly in the activity section.
For example: "Waiting for support" status is not translated:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Statuses in the Approval section on the portal view is not translated to selected language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The emoticons placed in Confluence pages changes in shape and color as well once viewed in Jira service desk.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence , add :arrow_down: and :star: (yellow star) emoticons . !image-2020-01-27-17-56-38-833.png|width=354,height=137!
 # Once published, the emoticons appear different at Jira service desk page compared to Confluence page .
 # The down arrow changes to blue star and yellow star as well changes to blue star.  !image-2020-01-27-17-58-10-010.png|width=275,height=109!

h3. Expected Results

Emoticons in Jira service desk should be displayed as they are in Confluence pages.
h3. Actual Results

The emoticons shape and color are changing.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Emoticons change for Confluence pages when viewed in Jira service desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New users added to via the People Section of a service desk project to "Service Desk Customer Role" automatically receiving the Site Access with a Service Desk license even though the option "New users will have access to this Product" is disabled for Jira Service Desk under Administration > Product Access:

 !Screen Shot 2020-01-27 at 1.11.00 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to the instance ( As a Site admin or as just a Jira admin)
# Go to the Service desk project> Project Settings> People
# Add any random/new email address and assign it to just the "Service Desk Customer" role
# Now go back to User Management page or if you are not the site admin ask a site admin to login to UM page and search for this added user
# We will see that the user whom we added in the people section now has Site Access as well is assigned with a service desk license

h3. Expected Results
If new users are allowed to be added via Peopl section of the project, the Role assignment should be respected hence when users are added as customers only (by adding them to the Service desk customer role only) and not to the team role,  they should not get a license

h3. Actual Results

Assigning a customer with a service desk license

Logs:

{code}

   logger_name: com.atlassian.usermanagement.invitation.InvitationServiceImpl
   m: { [+]
   }
   message: User with aaId: ******* invited successfully
   
}

{code}


{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Invite the customers from the customer section of the Project and not from the People section
fields.summary: Customer added via People section of the Project gets an Agent license

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As we already aware "Request Participant" field are expected not to display in "Create Issue" screen as we already have the feature request below :-

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1511

It's best to update the public documentation about this and the customer will aware about it .

h3. Suggested Solution
Update the [Add Request Participant|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/add-request-participants-from-the-issue-view/] documentation , mention about it's not possible to add "Request Participant" field to "Create Issue" screen.

h3. Why this is important
 This is to assure customer aware about this.
fields.summary: Update "Add Request Participant" documentation about its not possible to add in "Create Issue" screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Not possible to hide Knowledge base field on the new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your project settings > Request Types
# Click on *Edit fields* for the desired Request Type
# Drag and drop the KB field to the hidden column.

h3. Expected Results
* Field should be hidden
!hidden.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
* The field is still being shown on UI

h3. Workaround
None available at this time.
fields.summary: Not possible to hide Knowledge base field

fields.description: Set My request as the landing page when a customer logs in to the help center so that they can first view their current requests
fields.summary: Set My request as the landing page when a customer logs in to the help center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When Atlassian account Jira Service Desk customers access the link to a Jira Issue that they have access (https://site.atlassian.net/browse/KEY-1), they are not being correctly redirected to the respective portal link of the request (https://site.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/KEY-1).


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Atlassian Account Jira Service Desk customer (Atlassian account without any application access)
# Logged in as the customer, create a ticket in a Jira Service Desk project.
# Copy the issue URL and paste in a comment on the ticket. (This should render the "Agent URL" of the ticket)
# Click on the issue link

h3. Expected Results

The page reloads and you'll be redirected to the same ticket.


h3. Actual Results
You'll be redirected to the Help Center (https://site.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals)
 
h3. Notes

This doesn't affect portal only accounts.

h3.Workaround
- Access the ticket via "Requests" in the top-right corner of the screen.
fields.summary: Issue link redirection not working for Atlassian Account customers

fields.description: folders partially selected should be ticked with a grey tick
fields.summary: File status > Tree view: folders partially selected should be ticked with a grey tick

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sending an email to *abc@madeupinstance.atlassian.net* (intended for project *ABC*) with the subject *XYZ-123* results in the body of the email going to *XYZ-123* as a comment instead of a new issue in *ABC* with the email's subject as the *Summary* and the email's body as the *Description*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in one project
 # Send an email to the mail channel for a different project containing the issue key of the issue created in the previous step

h3. Expected Results

An issue is created in the project that the mail channel belongs to with the *Summary* set to the email's *Subject* and the *Description* set to the email's body.
h3. Actual Results

The email's body is added as a comment to the existing issue in a different project (from the one associated with the mail channel).
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mail channel comments on an existing issue in the wrong project if the subject contains an issuekey from a different project

fields.description: When the solution its between two or more responsables it's better assignee to all the responsables
fields.summary: Assignee more than one responsables in a ticket

fields.description: We are having many issues with Bitbucket and Atlassian. When we send invites from Bitbucket our SSO want to take it back to Jira and not to bitbucket. We have to manually manipulate the invitation to enable the users to get the invite correctly and acccept it. We would like to see the ability to use more then one SSO configuration as there is only one with Atlassian Access. We are currently using Ping Federation for a SSO service which doesn't play well with the way Bitbucket invites are sending. I have seen other SSO providers have exception or add a second SSO config for suite programs it would be nice if you could do the same.
fields.summary: Atlassian Access excepting more then one SSO configuration

fields.description: In our environment we have lots of tickets coming from multiple areas as many companies do. It would be nice that the do not share can be default or turn the share off for specific organizations within our Atlassian environment.
fields.summary: Able to Turn of Share from Portal or make not to share default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you're in the *People* menu and you access the *Role Filter* to adjust the Roles of the user the system is not displaying the full name of the default Service Desk roles, so, it's not possible to know if the user has the *Service Desk Team* or the *Service Desk Customer* role.

 !role.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Access the *People* menu of the project.
# In a user that is already included in the project select the *Role Filter*.
# It will not be possible to see the full name of the Service Desk roles.

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to see the full role name.

h3. Actual Results

The system is just displaying the beginning of the role name.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, it's possible to display just the users of a specific role.

 !filter.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Role filter is not displaying the full name of the Default Service Desk roles.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding the *jira.issue.editable* property to a status, editing the issue in that status in the new issue view is still possible although the changes cannot be saved.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the *jira.issue.editable* property to the Closed Status. Publish the workflow.
 # Edit the request type in Closed status

h3. Expected Results
Request type cannot be edited
h3. Actual Results
The fields can be edited but cannot be saved

h3. Workaround
Since the fields are expected to not be editable, being able to edit but changes are not saved does not require a workaround.
fields.summary: Adding jira.issue.editable property to a status does not prevent editing of request type

fields.description: In the old view, you could see in the attachment section, the date and time of the upload, in the new view you can't. It's annoying because it was very useful. Please, restore this in the new view.
fields.summary: New view, attachment section, add date and time

fields.description:
Currently, when user clicks "Share with Customer", the comment will be immediately updated.
To prevent internal information being accidentally shared, it will be great if we have the ability to approve the comment before it will be shared.
fields.summary: Ability to add approval for "Share with Customer"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issues that have been moved out of a Classic deleted Jira Service Desk project, to a NextGen Service Desk cannot have their issue type edited.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request in a Classic Jira Service Desk project. Make sure that the *Request Type* is set.
# Move the ticket to a NextGen project.
# Delete the Classic JSD Project.
# Edit the ticket's issue type. Make sure that the destination issue type users a different workflow.

h3. Expected Results

The issue type is changed successfully

h3. Actual Results

The edit operation will be locked in the following step

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Contact the Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Unable to edit the issue type after the issue was moved from a deleted project

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

With the recent change regarding the comments view on the Portal now when activity items are hidden, users can click a "Show X more" button, where X = 5, or the number of items yet to be shown if there are less than 5 to reveal.

This causes customers with long requests, let's say with 50 comments +, to have to click multiple times in order to review the full content of the ticket.

h3. *Suggested resolution*

It would be great to have the ability to display all comments or to turn on/off the Show/Hide functionality.
fields.summary: Improve the Show/Hide ( Collapse ) comments functionality from the Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently , by default all agents will have the visibility on the customer list.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have option to restrict agents from viewing the customer list.

h3. Why this is important
 Incase there's some agent should not have the access to view the customer list , there's option for administrator to restrict it.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: As JIRA Service Desk administrator, I would like to be able to restrict agents from viewing the customer list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting the profile language to Slovak , wording below still remain in English :-
* Request Type
* Request Participants
* Organizations
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set profile language to Slovak
 # View the issue

h3. Expected Results
Wording translated to Slovak language.

h3. Actual Results
Wording display in English

h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Profile set to Slovak doesn't translate "Request Participants, Request Type, Organizations" word

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A new comment will be added to the existing ticket, instead of creating a new ticket, when an email is forwarded to a different mail server/mail request if it contains the email threads of the existing tickets

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send an email to an email request support@<domain>.atlassian.net
# In the same thread, click on reply or forward to helpdesk@<domain>.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results
The second email is to raise a new issue in the helpdesk project

h3. Actual Results
The second email adds a comment to the existing issue.

h3. Workaround
Start a new thread
fields.summary: Comment gets added to an existing issue when an email is forwarded to a different email request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, images without any link in a Service Desk portal's article are not clickable

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Why this is important
The customer portal article view is too narrow. Screenshots are being resized to a point where they are not visible and unusable. For example:

* In Confluence:
 !image-2020-01-19-10-01-32-221.png|thumbnail! 
* In Service Desk portal:
 !image-2020-01-19-10-03-47-933.png|thumbnail! 

In the Confluence old editor, images can be assigned a link.  This would allow images to be hosted in external storage and stored its original size. This means that a user could click on the resized screenshot in the portal view and then get a larger view of that screenshots. However, in the new editor, this is no longer possible. Images on the new editor can longer act as a hyperlink.

h3. Additional Information
As the old editor is getting deprecated, it seems logical to implement this on a Service Desk portal's article OR allow the images on the Confluence new editor to be assigned a link.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Open images in original size when clicked in Service Desk Portal Articles

fields.description: As an agent (or any internal Jira user), I need to see the customer-facing Status Names in addition to the Status Names from the workflow. It's helpful to know what the current status is that the customer sees and what the customer will see when selecting a transition of status.
fields.summary: As an agent, I need to see the customer-facing Status Names in addition to the Status Names from the workflow.

fields.description:
*Problem description*
At this time on the [new issue view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/changes-to-requests-in-the-new-issue-view/] when a user raises a requests it shows a message saying:
{quote}
"John Doe" raised this request via "Request Channel"
{quote}

!raised.png|thumbnail!

If we change the reporter of the ticket it says that the new user has raised the request.

*Suggestion:*
* Start using the creator field's value
* Rephrase the sentence
fields.summary: New issue view "raised this request via" sentence is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Service Desk locked fields (Request Type, Approvers, etc) are not translated in the New Issue View.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Change your preferred language.
# Access the Jira Service Desk project.

h3. Expected Results

All fields are properly translated.


h3. Actual Results

JSD fields are not translated.
 
 !image-2020-01-17-17-28-08-989.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk locked fields are not translated in the new issue view.
Make user-picker limit configurable in Service desk portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's possible to create customers in a Service Desk project with invalid emails: *@gmail.com, %#@dummy.com, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Go to the Customer section.
# Create a customer with an invalid email 

h3. Expected Results

A validation would block users from creating invalid emails.

h3. Actual Results

JSD allows the creation of these users with invalid email, which causes problems when doing cloud to cloud migrations.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this.
fields.summary: JSD Cloud allows customers to be created with invalid emails

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
Currently, it's not possible to associate a screen with a workflow transition, so it's not possible to set fields that are required for transitions to be executed.

h3. Suggestion
Add the ability to associate a screen or a set of fields that need to be filled for a transition to be allowed.
fields.summary: Ability to associate a screen with a workflow transition

fields.description:
Please can you add the ability to automatically add a flag to a ticket when a customer replies to it. Currently we can not easily see when a customer has replied so we are not responding to them and this does not look good.

Checking emails is not an option as we have so many coming in.

Thanks
Nick
fields.summary: Add a flag to a ticket when a customer replies.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Translation are not loaded for request type and request language field even though they are available

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a service desk project, add more than one languages and enable them
 # Change your profile to one of the enabled languages
 # Raise a request from the portal using out of box request types
 # Open the issue from new issue view and check request type and request language fields.

h3. Expected Results
When user click on the field, dropdown menu should show translated request type/request languages as translations are available for out of box request types

h3. Actual Results
The field will only show translated text when the field is in view mode, the dropdown will load english text only

h3. Workaround
there is no workaround
fields.summary: Request Type and Request Language dropdown menu only load english text even though translations are available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing a request type via search in help center does not show "Contact us about" and "What can we help you with?".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for a request type and see these two sections are missing.
 # Navigate to the same request type manually and they do appear.

h3. Expected Results
The displaying of these sections should be consistent.

h3. Actual Results
The sections do not show when loading the request type from a search.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Accessing a request type via search in help center does not show "Contact us about" and "What can we help you with?"

fields.description:
I would like to ask if there is any feature in development for saving a form and retrieving it later while a Customer is filling in the request form.

There are times when entering information towards a particular request, the user tends to finish filling the data later or just wants to save the partially filled form to gather all relevant information necessary for filing. In such scenarios, it would be helpful for the user to save the form and return to the draft once they are ready with all information.
fields.summary: Ability to save a partially filled form and return to draft later for submission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Remote actions in Jira Service Desk automation fail to load in Next-gen projects, displaying a spinner indefinitely.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install an app in Jira that provides a remote action, such as ProForma
 # Create a Jira Service Desk Next-gen project
 # Go to Project settings > Automation
 # Create a new automation rule
 # Add a THEN action to the rule, selecting the action provided by the app

h3. Expected Results

The form should load, e.g. if using ProForma:

!image-2020-01-16-10-23-58-317.png|width=600px!
h3. Actual Results

The form does not load, just showing a spinner indefinitely.

!image-2020-01-16-10-23-36-549.png|width=600px!
h3. Workaround

No known work-around at the moment, except for using a Classic project.
fields.summary: Adding a remote action to an automation rule on a Next-gen JSD project fails to load

fields.description: Our team would like two use the widget in the service desk, but it is open to anyone.  We would like to suggest allowing users to login to the widget so we can keep our proprietary information to users only.  The widget lets anyone create a request AND requires us to open up our knowledge base to everyone.
fields.summary: Allow the widget to be restricted to logged in users

fields.description: For some use cases, it is necessary to hide certain request types from the portal, but have them visible in Jira when creating a request. Currently, an agent must create the issue using a request type visible in the portal and then change to one not visible in the portal after request creation.
fields.summary: It would be nice if all request types were shown in the Jira create screen

fields.description:
For some use cases, it can be confusing to agents to have the *Issue types* and *Request types* under the *Type* field and it would be nice to be able to configure these fields to show up individually instead of all under a single field.

Perhaps Jira Service Desk could be setup to show *Type* when neither *Issue type* nor *Request type* are configured in the screen, but when one or both are, the *Type* field is not shown, but both *Request type* and *Issue type* are.
fields.summary: Allow the Type field to be broken into Request type and Issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Next-Gen Jira Service Desk issues are added into Jira Software boards, the Rank order is not respected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira Software (JSW) Classic project and a Jira Service Desk (JSD) Next-Gen one;
# Create a few issues in the JSD Next-Gen project;
# Update the Board filter in the JSW Board to bring the JSD issues.
# Try to reorder the issues in the JSW Board.

Video:  [^Screen Recording 2020-01-14 at 06.48 PM.mov] 

h3. Expected Results

The order is kept.

h3. Actual Results

The order of the issues is not kept.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When Next-Gen JSD issues are added into Jira Software boards, the Rank is not respected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you add a request type to "Hidden from portal" (by removing it from other groups), this request type is also hidden from the create issue screen, not being possible to create requests of this type via Jira ("+" button).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a service desk project > Project settings > Request types;
 # Choose a request type > click on *Edit groups* and uncheck all boxes;
 # Note that the request type will start showing under "Hidden from portal".

h3. Expected Results

The request type will only stop showing in the customer portal.
h3. Actual Results

The request type also disappears from the Create Issue screen (Jira "+" button).
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to hide request types only from the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a Jira Service Desk request for a next-gen Service Desk project from within Jira using the "Create" (+) button populates the label field with the default label(s) of the request type last used to create a request from within Jira, not the default label(s) configured for the request type selected in the "issue Type" drop-down menu.

Changing request types does not update the default label in the create form, neither does changing the project to another project and back again.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure default labels for multiple request types in a next-gen project
# Create a request for the next-gen project from within Jira by clicking the "Create" (+) button.

h3. Expected Results
The default label of the currently selected request type should be populated in the Labels field.

h3. Actual Results
The default label of the last request type created from within Jira is populated in the Labels field.

h3. Workaround

* On the Create issue screen, click "Configure fields", Choose "Custom", and remove the checkmark from "Labels".
* Manually change the labels in the Labels field to the correct ones.
* Create an automation rule to add labels to the corresponding request types.
fields.summary: Creating a request to a next-gen Service Desk project from within Jira does not add the correct default label
